intro: Melicope volcanica, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Melicope volcanica plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
